item.title: Core inflation rate watched by Fed hit 2.8%, delayed September data shows, lower than expected
item.description: The delayed core personal consumption expenditures price index for September was expected to show a 2.9% annual increase.

item.title: China slow-walks U.S. soybean purchases as stockpiles hit multi-year highs, undermining Trumpâ€™s trade deal claims
item.description: China will likely "slow-roll soybean purchases to bait the Trump administration into prolonged negotiations," an analyst says.

item.title: Layoff announcements top 1.1 million this year, the most since 2020 pandemic, Challenger says
item.description: The firm said layoff plans totaled 71,321 in November, a step down from October but still enough to bring the 2025 total up to 1.17 million.

item.title: Ukraine, trade, pandas: What China's Xi and France's Macron discussed in Beijing
item.description: China said it is open to importing more high-quality goods from France while urging a "fair, conducive environment" for Chinese businesses in the Euro...

item.title: November private payrolls unexpectedly fell by 32,000, led by steep small business job cuts, ADP reports
item.description: The payrolls decline marked a sharp step down from October, which saw an upwardly revised gain of 47,000 positions.
